channel.title: Introduction on COMP2221 – Functional Programming
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on COMP2221 – Functional Programming

item.title: Hello, World!
item.description: Beginnings # GHC provides either a compiler, with which we can compile a Haskell program into an executable, and an interpreter with a read-eval-print-loop. Initially, we’ll start off using the interpreter. It can be invoked with ghci, so at a terminal prompt run $ ghci When I show commands in the terminal, I will use a $ to indicate the prompt (which you should not type), followed by the command to type.
